intro: Aspidistra mirostigma, commonly known as the narrow-stigma aspidistra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that emerge from the base of the leaves. Aspidistra mirostigma is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in low-light conditions.
